Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of Peta-Scale Data Storage System for Big Data Exploration in STEM Fields

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award is co-funded by EPSCoR program.
This MRI project is to acquire a petascale data storage system to add to the existing high-performance computing (HPC) systems at the University of Arkansas at Little Rock (UALR). The projects concern analysis of medical images, cosmological simulations, social network analyses and protein structure prediction. A number of well-developed broadening participation activities in education and research are proposed.
The project augments existing high performance computing capabilities, includes projects in different disciplines to be facilitated by cyber upgrades, provides integration of research and education through training opportunities for students at all levels, and has a potential for broadening participation and development of a diverse scientific workforce.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The major outcome of this MRI award has been to expand computational, storage and network infrastructure capacity for diverse research associated with large-scale datasets at the University of Arkansas at Little Rock (UALR). The research projects include (1) analysis of large-scale medical Images, (2) investigating individual, group, and interorganizational behavior through novel computational social network analysis, (3) 3-D protein structure prediction, (4) evaluating architectures for large-scale entity resolution, and (5) Cybersecurity simulations. Furthermore, the infrastructure is designed to accommodate other projects with various storage requirements such as hadoop/hdfs.

The infrastructure designed and installed is managed by an OpenStack setup. This allows for running disk-less nodes booting only hypervisor software. Actual operating-system deployments are provided by virtual machines managed by OpenStack, which allows for dynamic balancing of resource usage as well as dynamic reallocation according to different use cases (e.g., homogeneous HPC, continuous integration). OpenStack is also used for managing user access to the cluster and its nodes as well as to the upgraded storage facilities.

 

We upgraded the primary storage solution to an extensible 10TB system by Oracle. This storage solution provides resources for users needing to feed data into and from the compute cluster at very high data rates. It also is used to providing external user access to their data.

Our user base currently consists of institutional users from the biochemistry and bioinformatics domain of both UALR and UAMS. We are also preparing for possible extension of our setup provided through an EPSCOR grant, which extend the user base to collaborators across the state of Arkansas. 

The MRI infrastructure developed under this award has been supporting existing research efforts as well as enabling the development of the new cybersecurity track. It has helped on the facuty recruiting and retention efforts as well.
